etymons.notes: cf. Syr. ʕṭāšā, SL 1094-1095: sneezing; ʕuṭṭāšā, SL 1079, sneeze; cf. JPA ʕṭš (Pa.
etymons.raw: cf. Syr. ʕṭāšā, SL 1094-1095: sneezing; ʕuṭṭāšā, SL 1079, sneeze; cf. JPA ʕṭš (Pa.

translations: ʻeben, als du geniest hast, bin ich herausgekommenʼ;

Infectum.turoyo: hakka i=naqla d-ʔaṯi ko-šoʕəl w-mʕaṭəš, i=naqla də-mʕaṭəš ko-mʕarəṭ
translations: ‘When he comes, he will cough and sneeze. And when he sneezes, he will also break wind’ 75/33;
